readability_reflection: String interpolation because the curly braces separate context in a readable line -- it acts as a variable placeholder
comprehension_debugging: the long examples that contained O^2 was rather difficult to interpret, and I find it confusing about the + addition in string contexts
preference_rationale: String interpolation because it gives a clear separation for what is string "" and when need to append a variable, you separate it with curly braces, which are rarely used in programming string outputs
learning_curve: I come from C++ and Java, so I think the string interpolation felt more naturally. I also do python and i still use string interpolation because that is easier for my comprehension (despite python bragging about the concatenation aspect)
suggestions_improvement: String concatenation should not even be an option in the first place
